Case reference: 2013000127.CaseDesc: Howard Graveline dissappeared from his home on décembre 29, 2011.  His car, passport and wallet were left behind.

Case reference: 2019010367.CaseDesc:
Simeon Bear was last seen on July 23, 1982 when he was last seen boating on Reindeer Lake,
heading out from Southend, Saskatchewan to Lawrence Bay during a storm.

Deformity: Right Hand, Disfigured index, middle and ring fingers

Case reference: 2020021517.CaseDesc: Ashley Collins was last seen on June 16, 2020 in Drayton Valley, Alberta. At the time of her disappearance, Ashley was leading a high risk lifestyle, and is diabetic.

Case reference: 2015020897.CaseDesc: In April of 2015, Delmer Paul Bonnetrouge was seen for the last time in Fort Providence, Northwest Territories. He was reported missing by his family.

Case reference: 2014005757.CaseDesc: Harley Boxall was seen leaving his residence in Nanaimo on March 9, 2012. A suicide note was located in his room suggesting he was going to drown himself. However, within weeks of being reported missing, there were unconfirmed reports of Mr. Boxall within the city of Nanaimo or that he may be residing with the homeless community in Vancouver’s lower-Eastside.

Case reference: 2014001191.CaseDesc: On April 22, 2010, the body of an unidentified man was found in the Richelieu River in Saint-Mathias-sur-Richelieu, Quebec. In his possession were a Hipstreet brand MP3 player and headphones. The images shown are facial approximation portraits of this unidentified man created by the Sûreté du Québec.

Case reference: 2014005200.CaseDesc: Conrad Hastings was last seen at the bus shelter at Smith Street and Portage Avenue.  His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2003006900.CaseDesc: Krzysztof Syrzycki was last seen in Coquitlam, British Columbia on June 29, 2002.

Case reference: 2014002337.CaseDesc: Timothy Peifer was last seen on the long weekend in September, 2002 in the Caddy Lake area of Manitoba.  Mr. Peifer's whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2021008992.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2021, Konstantin Boukhanov travelled to Toronto, Ontario without telling his family. Konstantin has not been seen since.

Case reference: 2006010799.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1979, Keith Cromwell was last seen as he departed from Quarry Island/Lake of the Woods, near Kenora, Ontario, in a motor boat. Keith never arrived at his destination, Fog Island.

Case reference: 2014005606.CaseDesc: Larry Duck of Tadoule Lake was last seen in April of 2011, in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Larry has not made contact with his family since. His whereabouts remain unknown.

Case reference: 2021056747.CaseDesc: On December 3, 2021, at approximately 12:45AM, Nivethan Alakeswaran was last seen leaving their residence in Brampton, Ontario. Nivethan's family last heard from him at approximately 7:00AM the same day.  Nivethan has not been seen or heard from since.

Jacket: Dark Blue, Navy jacket with brown fur on the hood

Case reference: 2015056222.CaseDesc: On October 15, 2015, Robert Luery was last seen on Lake Simcoe where he was sailing in strong winds.  His sail boat was located floating around the lake unoccupied.  An extensive search of the lake was completed and Robert was not located.

Case reference: 2016061151.CaseDesc: On April 29, 2014, a male was recovered from a reservoir behind Energy Ottawa, building #511 at 4 Booth Street, Ottawa. His appendix and gallbladder are present. It is believed that he had been in the water for a few days to a few months.

Hair: Brown, Medium length; balding and face stuble
Teeth: Extensive amount of dental work including root canal, crowns, posts and composite resin fillings.
Other: Red, Purple, Lavender, Mauve, 2 disposable lighters
cigarettes in a white opaque plastic container
a hand drawn map of the Richmond Rd/Churchill Ave area, drawn on a torn off cover of a notepad
folding knife with built in nail file and opener on a ring
3 keys (SM "ILCO" key, Curtis "SC1" & Oscar "WR3" house keys)

Case reference: 2016068414.CaseDesc: On August 30, 1965, this unidentified male was found on the shore of Lake Ontario just east of the harbour pier in Oshawa. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 160 lbs, however, this may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present and he was not circumcised.

Teeth: Decayed teeth; gold inlay and prosthesis in his upper dentition; lower dentition had an amalgam filling
Shoes: Leather, Veritough, one left shoe; size 7
Scar: Right Upper Arm, circular puckered scar 1" in diameter on the anterior right underarm
Tattoo: Right Forearm, blue tattoo of a woman's face

Case reference: 2014004849.CaseDesc: In the evening of November 21, 2006, Yves Castonguay left his residence in Bécancour, Gentilly sector. He may have been spotted a few times; however Mr. Castonguay has had no contact with his family since this date. His family have reason to fear for his health and safety.

Case reference: 2014001522.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1977, James Stackhouse and a friend were camped on a small island on the east shore of Lake Winnipeg, north of Hole River where they were doing some mapping. Their boat drifted away to the south towards Deer Island located 3 miles south. At approximately 6:00 p.m. both men left the shore holding onto some small logs that they had tied together with their belts. They attempted to swim to Deer Island but the current and the waves carried them to 1/4 mile east of Deer Island. The bundle of logs that they had tied broke and the men were separated. Mr. Stackhouse's friend managed to swim to Deer Island but he did not see Mr. Stackhouse again. Searches of the area were done by land, air and water but the body of Mr. Stackhouse was not recovered. He is presumed deceased due to drowning.

Case reference: 2009001399.CaseDesc: Calvin Vanness was last seen on March 26, 2008 at approximately 2:30 PM in the Quinte Mall parking lot in Belleville, Ontario. He last spoke to his family to make plans to meet later that day. When he failed to meet them, his family attempted to locate him, then reported him missing on March 31, 2008. His car was located on April 1, 2008 at the Highway 38 car park in Kingston, Ontario. He was known to carry large sums of money and some cannabis. Mr. Vanness has not accessed any of his bank accounts since his disappearance.

Case reference: 2014003107.CaseDesc: Jean Fournier was last seen in Montreal on August 30, 1993. He was very stressed and depressed. He left a letter for his wife stating that he was leaving all of his belongings to her. He left his house with little money in his pocket.

Sweater: Cotton, Cream, Ivory, Black, black stripes

Case reference: 2019048180.CaseDesc: On August, 11, 2019, Miranda Belle was seen for the last time by her ex-spouse at a family gathering in Winnipeg, Manitoba. Miranda was last heard from via Facebook, on August 17, 2019.

Case reference: 2019000913.CaseDesc: On January 1, 2019, Daniel Hill was seen for the last time in Medicine Hat, Alberta.

Case reference: 2015011636.CaseDesc: On June 20, 1998, a fisherman saw the body of a man floating in the St. Lawrence River in front of L'île aux Vaches.

Socks: White, Grey, white top and gray on bottom
Tattoo: Right Shoulder, sword and a cross

Case reference: 2014004868.CaseDesc: On May 13, 2004, at approximately 8:00 a.m., Stephen Liou was seen for the last time as he left his home in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2008007698.CaseDesc: John McColl left a note at his parent's home on January 27, 1979 stating that he was travelling to Nassau, Bahamas via the United States. He is known to have visited with friends in London, Ontario at the beginning of December, 1979.  Also, he purchased an airline ticket on December 14, 1979 in San Francisco. Family had noted that Mr. McColl was depressed at the time.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Middle Finger, previous break from injury/trauma

Case reference: 2006003399.CaseDesc: On November 2, 2001, this male, was found in a sewer at 470 Lansdowne Avenue in Toronto. His ancestry is Caucasian, possibly Egyptian or mixed African/Caucasian. He had previous surgery of his left forearm, which had involved the implant of surgical plates. The numbers visible on the surgical plates could not be traced to a specific individual, however, it was determined that the lot was released some time after May 25, 1994. A MacDonald’s name tag with the name "Raymond" was found in the sewer, which may or may not be related to this individual.

Teeth: Visible Missing, Teeth were stained, which suggests he may have been a smoker,  his upper central incisors were also missing
Fractured/Broken Bones: Left Hip, recent fracture of left hip

Case reference: 2014002021.CaseDesc: On August 28, 1973, James Martin was last seen in Richmond, British Columbia. It was speculated that James wanted to start a new life and assume a new identity. Robert has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014001046.CaseDesc: On July 23, 1990, the body of this middle-aged man was found on Gore Avenue in Vancouver, British Columbia. He died of complications related to chronic alcohol dependence.

Hair: Blonde, Long dark blonde hair with greying beard
Jacket: Denim, Blue, Young Life Creator brand
Shoes: Grey, Nike Air brand, running shoes

Case reference: 2019012891.CaseDesc: Dean Brett Todd was last seen by his brother, around Easter time in 2000, near First Memorial Services Kamloops (formerly Schoening Funeral Home) on Tranquille Road in Kamloops, British Columbia. Dean had been invited to dinner, but did not show up. Dean is known to travel between Kamloops and Edmonton, Alberta.

Case reference: 2018055666.CaseDesc: On October 18, 1991, Kristina Rhodes was seen for the last time in Port Elgin, Ontario. Kristina was also known to frequent the towns of Southampton and Hanover, Ontario.

Case reference: 2016061381.CaseDesc: On April 25, 1970 a Caucasian male was found in the ravine just north of Beechwood Ave. The ravine was located 300 yards south of the Leaside Bridge and approximately 100 yards east of the Don River.

Other: Rifle - Winchester Model 94 30-30 calibre, with a black and white rifle case

Case reference: 2006005099.CaseDesc: Gary Millerson was last seen at his residence in Port McNicoll on the 19 April 1991.

Case reference: 2021000674.CaseDesc: On December 30, 2020, Tyler Desorcy was seen for the last time in the 900 block of Pandora Avenue in Victoria, British Columbia. Tyler has no fixed address and he has not been seen or heard from by his family, which is out of character for him.  Tyler is known to walk with a notable limp.

Hair: Brown, Dark brown receeding hair with some facial hair

Case reference: 2013000081.CaseDesc: On May 21, 1995, John Kargakos was reported missing when he was last seen swimming by a neighbour in Lac St-Louis au bord de l'eau located in the Dorval district of Montreal, Quebec. John has Alzheimer’s disease.

Case reference: 2006008599.CaseDesc: Adrien McNaughton wandered off into a wooded area of Holmes Lake, Brougham Township, on June 12, 1972.

Scar: Forehead, approximately 1 - 2 inches long, and possibly over the left eye.

Case reference: 2022031763.CaseDesc: Shortly after midnight on December 27, 1980, Paul Elliott was seen for the last time near the Table Rock in Niagara Falls, Ontario. During the time of his disappearance, Paul was despondent.

Pants: Brown, Corduroy, May have been wearing corduroy pants
Blue, JEANS, May have been wearing jeans
Shirt: Blue, T-SHIRT, The brand may have possibly been Levis

Case reference: 2014002505.CaseDesc: On January 27, 1988, Lisa Somerton was seen for the last time outside of her residence located at 1220 Merivale Road in Ottawa, Ontario. She was observed approaching a black sports car with two people inside.

Case reference: 2018063244.CaseDesc: On June 9, 2001, at approximately 11:00 a.m., Marilyn Payne was seen for the last time when she left the hostel she was staying at.

Case reference: 2020054047.CaseDesc: On December 21, 2020, MacKenzie Trottier was seen for the last time in the 300 block of Trent Crescent in Saskatoon, Saskatchewan.  At the time of her disappearance, MacKenzie may have been in a vulnerable state.

Hair: Blonde, Long, Shaved on right side

Case reference: 2012020033.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1997, Daniel Gaulton went out with some friends to the Park Hotel. He had called his place of work to take the day off from his job as a security guard at a local construction site. At approximately 9:00 p.m. Daniel went to an ATM and withdrew cash. At around 11:00 p.m. he returned home. He had a brief conversation with his roommate, and left in his 1985 Chrysler LeBaron.

Tattoo: Left Upper Arm, head of a wolf (black) set in a moon (orange)

Case reference: 2014005045.CaseDesc: William MORGAN was last seen during the early morning hours of October 28, 1968, at a cabin near Moose Mountain Provincial Park, approximately 12km north of Arcola, SK. At the time of his disappearance, Mr. MORGAN was planning to go out hunting in the area for deer. He had no vehicle and had a slow deliberate walk. A 30-30 rifle was also found to be missing from the cabin. Searches of the area have failed to locate any sign of Mr. MORGAN.

Tattoo: Left Forearm, blue flag and eagle

Case reference: 2018008750.CaseDesc: On February 17, 2018, Ryan Shtuka was last seen at approximately 2:10 am and was believed to have left a party on Burfield Drive to walk home to his residence located a short distance away in Sun Peaks. Ryan did not attend his job as scheduled later that day and has not been active on social media or his cell phone since.

Shirt: White, Grey, Button Up, Grey arms and collar, partial button up
Shoes: Size 11, flat bottom sole shoes similar to VANS

Case reference: 2007003099.CaseDesc: Christina Calayca was camping with friends at Rainbow Falls Provincial Park located near Schreiber, Ontario. At approximately 6:30 am Ms. Calayca indicated to a friend that she was going jogging and was last observed on a park campground roadway. Ms. Calayca never returned to her campsite and has not been heard from since. An extensive ground and air search has been conducted by the Ontario Provincial Police but Ms. Calayca has not been located.

Case reference: 2014005207.CaseDesc: On June 01, 2008, Bartholomew MacIsaac was seen for the last time in Calgary, Alberta.

Case reference: 2014003280.CaseDesc: On July 7, 1998, Peter Dekoning was reported missing after failing to return home from making his restaurant deliveries. He was last seen at Jackfish Lake near Two Hills where he was believed to have stayed for several days. His vehicle was located near the North Saskatchewan river with the keys missing. There was no sign of foul play. A search of land and water was unsuccessful.

Pants: Dark Blue, Black, pants were either dark blue or black
Scar: Jaw, long white scar down right side of chin

Case reference: 2014003706.CaseDesc: Albert Crow and a friend attempted to cross Harrop Lake, Manitoba in a canoe despite high winds and the rough water. A second party in another canoe was ahead of Mr. Crow's and observed at one point of the crossing that the canoe was no longer visible. Searches were made of the shoreline and dragging operations of the lake were undertaken at the time without success. On October 12, 1974, the body of Mr. Crow's friend was recovered. His cause of death was later determined to be drowning. Albert Crow is presumed also dead due to drowning.

Case reference: 2014002786.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1975, Gaétan Poulin was seen for the last time leaving his family home in Montreal, Quebec, to go to a bar.

Case reference: 2014002472.CaseDesc: In April 1988, Stacey Rogers was seen for the last time as she left her residence in Taylor, British Columbia. Stacey had stated that she was planning on travelling to Edmonton, Alberta, but did not go to Edmonton. It is possible that she went to Grande Prairie, Alberta.

Case reference: 2011005799.CaseDesc: On June 20, 2011 Ibrahim Sendaigre was driving on Highway 17 between Terrace Bay and Marathon, Ontario.  He was involved in a motor vehicle accident and fled the scene into the bush area. Police searches of the area yielded negative results. Mr. Sendaigre has not been located and has had no contact with family or friends. Last Seen: Highway 17, Tuuri Township.  Approximately 4 km west of the Steel River bridge near Black Fox Lake.  This area is essentially located between the towns of Marathon and Terrace Bay, in Northwestern Ontario.

Case reference: 2020048673.CaseDesc: On September 27, 2020, Geoffrey Irwin was last seen on a Royal Bank of Canada surveillance camera in Langford, British Columbia and has not been seen since. On November 25th,2020, Geoffrey Irwin's black 2017 Ford Escape was located at Park Royal Mall in West Vancouver, British Columbia. Geoffrey is known to travel between the West Shore and the Lower Mainland.

Backpack: Nylon, Black, Grey, Black with grey stripes, with zipper
Jacket: Cotton, Grey, Hooded with white drawstrings
Shorts: Synthetic, Brown, Taupe or light brown colour with pockets, size large

Case reference: 2006010899.CaseDesc: Larry Zink left his home in Delavan, Wisconsin, USA. Family members have indicated that he may have been depressed.  In October 1995, Mr. Zink's vehicle was located unoccupied in a gravel pit 65 km north of Pickle Lake, Ontario.  Mr. Zink has not been seen since.

Teeth: False, Upper teeth and partial bottom teeth - front bottom teeth are his own

Case reference: 2019013046.CaseDesc: In August 2018, Celia Maria Da Silva was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014001691.CaseDesc: Norman Krolman was last seen withdrawing money from an ATM machine.  He was a self-employed computer programmer and was in business with a partner.  He had a steady girlfriend and a small circle of friends.

Case reference: 2014004681.CaseDesc: On November 22, 1965, Archie Laroque was hunting with six other people near Laroque Lake, 48 kilometers east of Carrot River, SK. The hunting party split up and Archie was last seen walking in an area alone. Extensive ground and air searches were conducted, however, Archie was never located.

Case reference: 2014004475.CaseDesc: On the morning of October 1, 1976, Crystal Van Huuksloot was seen for the last time with her suitcases in Toronto, Ontario. Crystal had traveled from Edmonton, Alberta to help raise funds for her boyfriend. She stayed in Toronto for one week, but did not board her return flight to Edmonton.

Case reference: 2016061231.CaseDesc: On May 18, 1968, an unidentified male was found hanging in a hotel room. He had checked in under the name Henry Drendorf. No identification was found. This individual was found with several bags of architectural books.

Case reference: 2014002743.CaseDesc: On January 16, 1994, Yoann Crouzatier was reported missing after leaving the family residence in Laval, Quebec. Yoann has not been seen or heard from since.

Boots: Black, Silver, Aluminum, Stainless Steel, Metal tips
Coat: Beige, Three-quarters with fur trimmed hood

Case reference: 2016061228.CaseDesc: On June 14, 1970, a male was found floating in Lake Ontario near the mouth of the Humber River. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 201lbs and his length was measured at 5'10", however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His appendix was present. He is thought to have been in the water for a few days to several days.

Shoes: Black, only the left shoe has laces

Case reference: 2006002199.CaseDesc: On September 23, 1994, this Caucasian male, was found in a field on the south side of the Rogers Centre (formerly known as the SkyDome) at the far end of Rees Street in Toronto. His post-mortem length was approximately 6’2" and he weighed 162lbs, however, these measurements may not represent his actual living weight and height due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy.

Teeth: Missing several teeth; had a great deal of restorative work done in the past with multiple silver-amalgam restorations

Case reference: 2012020057.CaseDesc: Peter Halcrow was last seen on March 14, 1994 walking in the "Sawmill" area between 14:00 and 15:00.  Mr. Halcrow has not been seen since.

Shoes: Leather, Green, White, Reebok with purple

Case reference: 2021019518.CaseDesc: On May 16, 2021, Bernard Grempel was reported missing from Surrey, British Columbia. On May 14, 2021, Bernard’s last known activity was when he used his Compass Card to tap onto a bus that travels back through New Westminster, North Delta and stops at the Scottsdale exchange at 120th Street and 72nd Ave in Surrey. He was last seen wearing a blue medical mask.

Tattoo: Right Forearm, Picture of Rick from Rick and Morty
Right Arm, We cannot resolve problems with the same…
Abdomen, Left rib - Other things may change but we start...
Left Upper Arm, Star of David

Case reference: 2005001799.CaseDesc: On June 1, 1975, the body of an older adult female was located on the west bank of the Niagara River, in the town of Niagara-on-the-Lake. She is believed to be the same person who was witnessed jumping into the Horseshoe Falls on February 17, 1975. She is thought to be 40 plus years, short and heavy-set, with brown hair. She suffered from lung disease and had severe arthritis of her lumbar spine, which may have been painful. When witnessed going over the Falls, she was wearing a long overcoat, possibly grey, and carrying a green umbrella. There is no confirmation that the jumper and the deceased are the same person, however the general descriptions are in agreement. The condition of her remains suggest that she had been in the water for weeks to months.

Teeth: This female probably had a partial dental plate and still retained a gold crown on her right upper canine tooth.

Case reference: 2020018331.CaseDesc: Riley Berland went missing from Frog Lake, Alberta, on May 31, 2020. Riley's family has not seen or heard from him since this time.

Case reference: 2009005299.CaseDesc: David Chevrier suffers from schizophrenia and functions at a low intellectual level. He was last seen at the Centre of Friends on Main street in North Bay.

Case reference: 2014002220.CaseDesc: Melvin Hoel was last seen in the Cataract Creek area where his abandoned vehicle with all his belongings was located by agents of Fish and Wildlife.

Case reference: 2023011080.CaseDesc: Keenan Venuk was last seen by her family in November 2017, and was last heard from via text message in February 2018. Keenan may be in Montreal, Quebec or Vancouver, British Columbia.

Scar: Unknown, Multiple linear scars on forearms
Tattoo: Left Ear, Pink music note, possible treble clef

Case reference: 1994001800.CaseDesc: On the evening of August 5, 1989, Casey Bohun was seen for the last time by her mother when she was put to bed in her home in Delta, British Columbia. Prior to her disappearance, Casey and her family had recently moved to this area, and she was not familiar with the neighbourhood. Today, Casey may not realize that she was abducted as a child.

Case reference: 2014005821.CaseDesc: Jacques Joseph Duguay was reported missing on May 31, 1982. On May 25th, 1982, his vehicle, a 1975 Chev 1/2 ton pickup was towed from Berry Mills Highway just outside Moncton, NB. The vehicle had been there since May 21st, 1982.

Case reference: 2014001731.CaseDesc: On August 5, 1987, Russell Atkinson was last seen boarding a Greyhound bus in Penticton, British Columbia. The bus was destined for Winnipeg, Manitoba.  Russell did not arrive in Winnipeg but his luggage was found on the bus.

Case reference: 2014003214.CaseDesc: On November 24, 1982, Clyde "Van" Ditmars was reported missing to the Thunder Bay Police Service by his family. Van sought work in British Columbia, Alberta and Manitoba in the early 1980s as a welder. Since being reported missing, Van's family has not heard from him and his whereabouts are unknown.

Scar: Abdomen, Surgical; from the center of chest to the belt line and then to the left
Abdomen, Surgical, horizontal on the left side
Neck, 1 1-2" raised scar on front of the neck

Case reference: 2021003909.CaseDesc: On April 6, 2018, Rita Squalli and Maria Squalli were last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Rita and Maria were taken by their father under false pretences, and it is believed that the girls are being kept overseas.

Case reference: 2014004907.CaseDesc: On March 7, 2006, at approximately 7:30 p.m., Quan Li, an international student, was seen for the last time by her landlord in Toronto, Ontario. Quan had advised that she would be away for a few days.

Case reference: 2014001088.CaseDesc: On September 13, 1973, the remains of an adult male were recovered from the Whirlpool of the Niagara River, in Niagara Falls. His post-mortem weight was recorded as being 165lbs, however, this measurement may not represent his actual living weight due to post-mortem changes noted at autopsy. His eye colour is believed to be brown. He was recovered without clothing.

Ring: Silver ring with a green stone on the third finger of his right hand
Watch: Cloth, Left wrist, had a red, yellow and blue watchstrap.

Case reference: 2012020650.CaseDesc: On February 11, 2007, Danita Bigeagle was seen for the last time near the 800 block of Victoria Avenue in Regina, Saskatchewan. Danita is known to frequent the city’s downtown area, and she rarely leaves Regina.

Jacket: Black, Winter, Quilted parka with drawstring waist
Tattoo: Left Hand, Happy face and the letter "d" on the web of her left hand

Case reference: 2008015599.CaseDesc: In late February 2006 William "Billy" Mason of Hamilton Ontario went missing. An extensive investigation has been conducted by the Hamilton Police Service but William Mason has not been seen or heard from since.  It is known that Billy Mason was murdered shortly after he went missing. The responsible person was convicted of his killing but Billy Mason's remains have not been recovered.

Case reference: 2014004820.CaseDesc: On September 21, 2006, William Teya was seen for the last time in Fort McPherson, Northwest Territories.

Jacket: Black, Dark; E. Gruben Transport on left chest

Case reference: 2008021099.CaseDesc: On September 17, 1966, Diane Prevost was seen for the last time as she was camping at Grundy Provincial Park in Britt, Ontario. During the time of her disappearance, Diane had been playing on the beach, and had told her father that she wanted to go back to the campsite. When her father turned to do so, she was gone.

Shirt: Blue, Red, checked top with red at cuffs and collar

Case reference: 2019049183.CaseDesc: On March 4, 2017, an unidentified woman was found in a state of acute confusion on East Cordova Street in Vancouver, British Columbia. She was taken to hospital, but died due to advanced and untreated breast cancer. She gave the name of Elizabeth MacKay to health services, but had no identification with her and her name could not be confirmed.

Case reference: 2014004478.CaseDesc: On May 1, 2004, Norman Halkett was last seen in Prince Albert, Saskatchewan.

Fractured/Broken Bones: Right Elbow, Transverse fracture across base of olecranon

Case reference: 2016057640.CaseDesc: In the early hours of October 10, 2016, Terence Alook was last seen when he left a party at his aunt's home in the community of Desmarais, Alberta. Mr. Alook had been visiting his friends and family in the north end of Desmarais.

Other: Chin, Two moles on the lower chin

Case reference: 2014001798.CaseDesc: On March 3, 1987, Nancy Dumas was reported missing. She was last seen by her daughter. Ms. Dumas had said that she was going to find her friends, and left her daughter's residence. She has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2014003070.CaseDesc: On February 20, 1996, Yolande Trudeau Laberge was seen for the last time near the Larocque Bridge in Salaberry-de-Valleyfield, Quebec. Yolande has not been seen or heard from since.

Scar: Right Arm, Under arm, approximately 1 inch

Case reference: 2017043661.CaseDesc: In February of 2017, Robert Kovacs was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. He was taken from Canada to Romania by his mother, Kinga Costiniuc.

Case reference: 2012020032.CaseDesc: Lorilee Francis was last known to be in Grande Prairie, Alberta. She has not been heard from by family or friends since approximately October of 2007.

Case reference: 2020049381.CaseDesc: On November 6, 2020 Sean Hart was last seen leaving Seven Oaks Receiving Home in Victoria, British Columbia.  Sean has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2012020170.CaseDesc: An adult male was washed up along the south side of the beach at Stanley Park, near the 2000 block of Beach Avenue at English Bay in Vancouver.

Wallet: Black, Contained pliers and a jack knife
Mark: Forehead, Post mortem abrasion on the right side of the forehead

Case reference: 2017013576.CaseDesc: On December 6, 2016, Hellen Ermias and her daughter, Lina Tedros, were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. All of their personal belongings were left behind in their apartment.

Case reference: 2020040348.CaseDesc: Muriel Jones was seen for the last time in 1959 in Toronto, Ontario. Muriel had indicated that she was intending on traveling to the West.

Case reference: 2014005307.CaseDesc: On August 14, 2006, Kevin Lim, Yee Wah Eva Ho and her boyfriend Jackie Li were seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Kevin, Yee Wah Eva and Jackie had been friends with Philip Sit who had been reported missing in 2005. Philip’s remains were found five days prior to Eva, Kevin and Jackie’s disappearance. Philip had been the victim of a homicide.

Hair: Black, Other, Dyed red and styled with spikes

Case reference: 2014005762.CaseDesc: On April 25, 2011, Yuji Fujita was seen for the last time in Toronto, Ontario. Yuji had called in sick to work on April 26 and has not been seen or heard from since.

Case reference: 2018005122.CaseDesc: On January 29, 2018, at approximately 6:30 a.m., Balwant Singh was last seen in Toronto, Ontario. Balwant was visiting Canada and failed to board his returning flight on January 29 at 6:00 p.m.

Case reference: 2018062675.CaseDesc: On November 3, 2018, Aaron Normandeau was seen for the last time by a friend on the Ottawa River in an aluminum boat. The boat capsized and Aaron went under the water and did not resurface.

Case reference: 2014004460.CaseDesc: Tsuguo Moroto left his place of business in Banff and rented a car on July 21, 1985. Several days later the vehicle was located at Panther Falls on Highway 93 North near Lake Louise, Alberta.  Several ground, aerial and waterway searches were conducted without success. Mr. Moroto was never located.

Case reference: 2017009362.CaseDesc: Badri Prasad Bhattarai, was reported missing on February 21, 2017, after his family became concerned that he had not been in contact with them. It is believed that Mr. Bhattarai’s last known location was in the area of the Walterdale Bridge, Edmonton. Mr. Bhattarai’s disappearance is out of character, and as a result, there are concerns for his well-being.

Chain: Black, Volkswagen Key Fob, House, Locker and mailbox keys
Key Ring with the letter "R" and a Swedish Flag
Ring: Gold, With 3 small clear stones worn on the left ring finger
Scar: Black dots, diabetes scars on both shins

Case reference: 2014004887.CaseDesc: On October 10, 2005, Ghassem Sabeiri Gilchalan was last seen in Toronto, Ontario.

Case reference: 2014006541.CaseDesc: Roxanne Fleming has not been seen since approximately 1986.  Around the time of last contact, she spent time in Lillooet, BC, Kamloops, BC, Vancouver, BC, Red Deer, AB, and Edmonton, AB.  The circumstances of her disappearance are unknown.

Case reference: 2021043326.CaseDesc: In the evening of September 20, 2021, Jeremiah Guthro was seen for the last time as he walked away from his residence in the Glebe neighbourhood in Ottawa, Ontario.

Case reference: 2018063020.CaseDesc: On November 1, 1997, Donghui Zhao was last heard from when he spoke with his friend in Toronto, Ontario. Donghui had not been seen or heard from for three months before his disappearance was reported.

Case reference: 2016060096.CaseDesc: Conrad Roderick Jason Ducharme was reported missing on October 25, 2016, by family members who had not heard from or seen him in two months. Conrad was last known by family to be hitch hiking to a meeting in Dixonville, Alberta in July 2016. He was last seen in Manning, Alberta, in early September 2016.
